comments.raw_text:
FWIW I don't think we want to take this for beta if it requires changing the branding via repo landing or buildbot config. If it is like bug 649678 it is probably ok....but we want the changes between beta and final to be MINIMAL TO NONE. Anything differing is added risk and can invalidate testing...these are the sort of "harmless" landmines that blow at critical points in a release.

Eventually we won't even rebuild between beta and final and will merely do a default channel repack.

Following a discussion in bug 701182, providing a little more direction here. We created some new copy for the Nightly and Aurora About dialogs, so that should also be updated for Beta and GA.

Theo may be able to help us out here as he did in the other bug.

Copy for Nightly and Aurora:

$PRODUCTNAME is experimental and unstable. It automatically sends test information back to Mozilla to help make Firefox better.

Mozilla is a global community working together to keep the Web open, public and accessible to all.


Copy for Beta and GA:

$PRODUCTNAME is designed by Mozilla, a global community working together to keep the Web open, public and accessible to all.


$PRODUCTNAME should be updated per channel as follows:

Nightly -> Firefox Nightly

Aurora -> Firefox Aurora

Beta -> Firefox Beta


The wordmarks should also be updated in the Nightly, Aurora and Beta dialogs. They can be found here: http://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/brand/identity/wordmarks/

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Matej Novak [:matej] from comment #35)
> I'm confused here as well. According to our branding guidelines, the
> Nightly, Aurora and Beta wordmarks should always appear with Firefox in
> front of them:
> 
> http://www.mozilla.org/en-US/styleguide/identity/firefox/wordmarks/
> 
> What's the reason we can't do that here? Gavin, can you clarify?

That's what we want when we (MoCo) distribute Firefox, sure. But we don't want the build output to be "Firefox Nightly" when Jimbo Dumbhacker produces his custom build with extra crashing, because that reflects poorly on "Firefox". So we need to continue having the default branding not be encumbered by the "Firefox" brand. Currently we use "Nightly" as the default branding, so we can't just simply change that branding package to include references to "Firefox".

None of this means that getting what we want is impossible, it's just more complicated than the obvious "just switch the image" solution, and so we haven't gotten around to doing it.
